intro: Sterigmostemum anchonioides subsp. stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anchonioid daisies, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. The plant's botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
